website_summaries.verdict: The Buffalo DriveStation DDR is by far the fastest single-volume external drive on the market and makes USB 3.0 a true alternative storage connection to Thunderbolt.
pros: The USB 3.0-based single-volume Buffalo DriveStation DDR external hard drive offers unprecedentedly superfast speeds -- even faster than high-end Thunderbolt storage devices -- at the same cost as most regular USB 3.0 storage devices
cons: As a single-volume drive, the Buffalo DriveStation DDR offers no options for data protection should its only internal hard drive fail

customer_reviews.title: Died twice
customer_reviews.text: Bought one which work beautifully for 3 days then died. Had it replaced and that one worked beautifully for exactly 31 days (1 day outside amazons return/replacement policy) then died. Something very wrong with these drives.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love Buffalo Tech but don't buy this product.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I can not recommend this product. After 1 month of use, the unit/drive has failed. Luckily, I never trust my data in one spot and have backups of all my files, in this case video. I don't know if this is a drive failure or the Buffalo enclosure itself but obviously, failure after one month is unacceptable. Reading the other reviews, it seems this drive is either hit or miss so if you buy this device you're gambling with your data.
customer_reviews.author: W.S.

customer_reviews.title: Buffalo Drives Do the Job: When a Drive Dies Buffalo Replaces Under Warranty
customer_reviews.text: I have been using four of these Buffalo DriveStation DDR High Speed USB 3.0 3 TB drives for about 2 1/2 years, with my Mac Pro. They are fast, quiet and stand up rather than having to lie flat and take up space. Just recently one of these disappeared from my computer and would not remount. I sent the purchase receipt to Buffalo, followed by the defective drive, and a new replacement drive is on its way to me, in accordance with the three year warranty. I like these drives.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Untrustworthy company -------
customer_reviews.text: On the Buffalo web site under "overview" it says, "Perfect for any PC or Mac®, ............". It also says, " designed to enhance computer performance and the day-to-day digital life of Windows® PC consumers; .........". All of which are lies. After spending several days & phone calls to Buffalo Tech, they finally admitted to me on the phone today that the DDR 3 drive is incompatible with Windows 7 Backup. I also spent several days searching the internet for solutions to Windows 7 Backup errors with the Buffalo DDR drive with no luck. There is nothing about this incompatibility on the Buffalo site. How convenient. Of course this is my last Buffalo product. The company just cannot be trusted.
customer_reviews.author: Charles F Toney

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable device -- don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: This drive maybe fast but it is very unreliable. The first one failed just a few days past Amazon's 1-month replacement. So I called BuffaloTech and got a RMA number. Had to pay for the $30 shipping. Then this replacement failed again in just 2 months. Both drives had the same problem -- it spins up when plugged in but the drive cannot be mounted. Explained the problem to BuffaloTech support but no explanation or solution was provided to recover the files, so all files were lost.
customer_reviews.author: winesap

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: Drive does not perform as promised. I cannot get consistent backups and find myself wondering why the backups are taking so long. I have even tried backups over the entire weekend to give the drive enough time but I still find myself forcing a stop to the backup and turning off my computer to get the drive to shut down. Backups are not reliable and I have tried multiple ways of making this investment work. UI is terrible and does not have any sort of status or progress to show. Any errors are not displayed until the actual error log is opened. Errors don't offer a solution. Updated firmware has not fixed the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Failed in less than 60 days
customer_reviews.text: I read the helpful reviews and purchased the product on 08/27/2013. It has already catastrophically failed (10/20/2013).. Due to the sensitive nature of the files written to the drive, I will not be returning it. Another reviewer wondered if the positive reviews were real. I wonder about that too. So I'm down about $150. Purchase one if you wish, but I've bought my last Buffalo product..
customer_reviews.author: Randol Hansen

customer_reviews.title: UGH!
customer_reviews.text: This external has been somewhat problematic. In a Windows environment it is VERY fast with its caching and software. Linux users beware! It crashed once on me, and I lost a TON of data but I was able to reformat it eventually and it seems to be OK again. It also ends up vibrating and has become somewhat noisy. I put rubber pads on it and it STILL makes a whiny noise! I would not purchase another.
customer_reviews.author: KD Cano

customer_reviews.title: Good, when it decides to work
customer_reviews.text: I have had intermittent problems using this as a backup device for my relatively new Macbook Pro. It spins up when connected, but the LEDs do not come on, and the computer does not recognize the drive. Weirdly, sometimes disconnecting and reconnecting the USB cable at the *back of the drive* brings it to life. Resetting PRAM and SMC does nothing. I am now convinced this is a Buffalo problem, not a Mac problem. The Buffalo website is entirely useless. I've had good luck with other Buffalo products (their NAS devices), but this one seems to be a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Philip E. Bowles

customer_reviews.title: nice but flawed.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this product. I own a media company and these drives seemed like a great fit. They are small the read and write speeds are extremely fast and they run quite. Unfortunately of the 5 we purchased 8 months ago only 1 is still functional. They all seem to have the same flaw where the computer stops detecting the drive. We have reached out to buffalo and while the offer warranty replacements they have not acknowledged a wide spread issue. Please keep in mind these drives are flawed and if you choose to purchase ensure your information is backed up.
customer_reviews.author: Petecpocala

customer_reviews.title: This was the first external hard drive I have purchased ...
customer_reviews.text: This was the first external hard drive I have purchased that lasted less than 2 years. The unit start making odd sounds a month ago and 3 days ago the power indicator light went out. I will try and contact them about a repair but guessing since it is out of warranty the cost of repair would cost me more than purchasing a new external drive. The only reason I am not incredibly upset is this unit was a backup for another backup of my Digital HD Movies.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Pace

customer_reviews.title: Really amazing and fast.
customer_reviews.text: I need a fast drive to store my media, music and games for streaming. I transferred a 30 gig file under 5 minutes, same could be said about lager files. This is perfect for a HTPC, due to the ergonomics. The reason I went with this Drive was because I read so many nightmares with the WD ones and others when it comes to the Terabyte market(But good when its 500gb), and Googling the "Top 1TB+ external" I notice this brand was up there. Went to Amazon, and saw this one listed with RAM. I was like, "Whatttttt!!!" A HDD with RAM, this has to be good, saw a few reviews and placed the order. I'm getting another one.
customer_reviews.author: ShinobiFist

customer_reviews.title: Great Drive
customer_reviews.text: This drive is 2.5X to 4X faster than my firewire 800 drive. It's really great but the software that comes with it for the MAC does NOT work on the current operating system. When you call tech support that are clueless about the drive and said the company released it without even telling them. Fortunately the software is only needed to change the settings. The default one are R/W cache enabled, which is what you want. It gets 4 stars for speed and 2 stars for tech support and useless software (two OS generations old).
customer_reviews.author: Mark L. James

customer_reviews.title: Meets expectations
customer_reviews.text: Delivery to my house was a bit slow... but UPS was having an unprecedented overflow of delivery requests this Christmas... so I will cut them some slack for that. The vendor clearly lived up to their end of the bargain...The product came out of the box clean, and installed quickly. It appears to be very solidly constructed. I expected a bit quicker backup, but still was much faster than my previous IOMEGA 1 Terabite hard drive. Perhaps my 10 year old server is part of the issue.. but overall, I would recommend this hard drive to anyone looking for a reliable solidly performing backup system.
customer_reviews.author: baldandbad

customer_reviews.title: Great price, zero warranty...go with cloud-based back-up instead
customer_reviews.text: While the cost per TB was great two years ago when I purchased it, the drive just died and the manufacturer's 90 day warranty ( doesn't help. How can they sell a product designed as a back-up solution but offer such a paltry support period? (And shame on me for not checking this before making the purchase). Luckily I had CrashPlan's cloud back-up as well -- so we're covered. This experience likely marks my 100% conversion to cloud storage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: New drive, used for two weeks, crashed -
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these drives a few years back. Great drive, never had a problem with it. I bought 3 more in December 2016, and I barely started using one of them due to travel. Less than a few weeks of use and the drive is making a "CLICKING" sound. Then my computer says that "the drive was ejected properly". It powers on, but all you hear is the clicks and the drive doesn't connect. I contacted the manufacturer, and I will update once Buffalo responds...
customer_reviews.author: Purchase Dept.

customer_reviews.title: Nonworking
customer_reviews.text: I bought it, put aside until I needed it for a project, and then it just wouldn't work. Web searches make me think it could be the power supply, but I haven't gotten far enough to figure out how to fix that or replace. I guess I'm glad I hadn't put all my valuable information on it already and then NEEDED it. As it is, I'm just out the cost of the drive. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: Fast but not Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two units new in August 2013. One unit failed in the first few months of operation and the other unit failed several months after the first. Both were replaced by the factory in an easy process. Then the two replacement units eventually failed in almost the same timeline as the first two. I experienced nice people at Buffalo and complement them on the good service I recieved in gaining needed replacements. It is true, this drive is very fast -- but not at all reliable. My advise is to be very cautious to back up any critical data to a reliable drive - not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Spaulding

customer_reviews.title: Do No Buy This Short-Lived Drive
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a series of external drives over the years. (As my data amount increases, I need more storage.) Among all of the drives I've owned, I've never had one die on me. This drive lasted less than two years and then died, taking my precious data with it. (Thank the maker for Time Machine.) Never again, Buffalo.
customer_reviews.author: C. S. Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Super fast but one failed early on.
customer_reviews.text: Super super fast. Bought two and one failed. Quality control could use some help. Would have easily gotten five stars except for the premature failure.
customer_reviews.author: K. L. Warseck

customer_reviews.title: Drive failed after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive to use as a Time Machine backup with my Mac after reading about it on The Wirecutter. Not only did the drive completely fail after five months, spinning up but never initializing, Buffalo's customer service was atrocious. The RMA process was long, complicated, and Buffalo makes you pay to send it back to them or charges you $30 to use their special service to send it back. I truly wish I hadn't bought this product. Edit: My REPLACEMENT drive has now failed less than a month later. Don't buy this drive, whatever you do!
customer_reviews.author: J. Young

customer_reviews.title: Working fine for me
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this drive a lot, and the professional reviews I read did too. I was concerned about the many negative reviews on Amazon, mostly about failures. I spoke to Tech Support at Buffalo and was told those failures mostly had to do with improperly dismounting the drive before shutting it down. I've been very carefully with this, and so far it has been fine.
customer_reviews.author: JC in VT

customer_reviews.title: FAILED FATALLY AT 13 MONTHS - ROCKY FOR 2 - 3 MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: i write very few reviews, but this item requires a warning. This Buffalo external hard drive failed fatally at 13 months. it has been problematic for the past 2 to 3 months only connecting intermittently. now it spins up, but won't connect to my laptop, EVER. BELIEVE THOSE NEGATIVE REPORTS, PEOPLE. FIND SOMETHING MORE RELIABLE...
customer_reviews.author: waldenpond

customer_reviews.title: 3 TB is worth having an additional drive to duplicate your stuff.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this drive for a short time and it seems to perform well. It is definitely fast. I did have a concern at the get go. I had to lift the jack with my thumbnail to plug the cable in and that worried me a bit. It prompted me to get another drive to duplicate stuff on to ensure I don't lose everything someday. For the additional drive I got a WD My Passport Ultra. 3 TB is an awful lot to lose should something crappy occur.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had it for a week or so, but it is Very quite and speedy as I moved about a TB of data onto it. Stayed cool too. I should say that it is quiet. Unlike my LaCie D2 Quadra 1TB External Hard Drive (USB 2.0 / eSATA / FireWire 400 & 800) drive which is very load. My other LaCie, the Rugged (orange cover) is very quiet just like the Buffalo which is fantastic. I have both sitting next to my 2007 iMac and cannot hear them.
customer_reviews.author: R. Galindez

customer_reviews.title: Did not work to clone another drive using Macrium Reflect
customer_reviews.text: I had intended to use this drive to clone another drive (running win 7). When I tried to clone the drive to the Buffalo 3T, I received an incompatability message dealing with sector sizes, source 512 v target 4096. This is a non-supported situation. I tried do do the same clone process with an XP machine and the error is the same. So while this could be a nice drive for general backups or file saving, it did not meet my needs. So it will go back today.
customer_reviews.author: Cathleen C

customer_reviews.title: Product failed in 40 days
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews i assumed this was a sound product. the product failed 40 days after installation. I've gone to an ioSafe, more expensive but i've had one running for two years without a problem
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Really fast *in practice*
customer_reviews.text: I got this drive based on the recommendation from the Wirecutter: [...]. I was wary initially wary of a large buffer inside the drive itself (what happens to the data if the cable disconnects?), but it's so fast that I usually don't spend a long time transferring to it. The main use case for me is backup, and I was pleasantly surprised to see ≈1TB of data backed up in an evening instead of dragging on overnight.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas G

customer_reviews.title: Beware! - Dead after a month - Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I usually read the product reviews before buying but this time I managed to overlook it. All the bad stuff you're reading about this product happened to me as well. It just quit working. After I put tons of my pictures and video there that is. I bought the product based on the recommendation of some product evaluation site. One of those that rate the top 10 of things. I'm not sure they don't get some fee for featuring things like this drive. I wouldn't use a Buffalo storage product not if you gave it to me.
customer_reviews.author: BallroomDJ

customer_reviews.title: Crazy fast!!!
customer_reviews.text: Installation was as simple as plugging in the drive and hooking up a USB cable. After about 30 seconds my drive was ready to use. After I installed the included TruboBooster software, transferring files was blazingly fast. I transfered 32gb in a matter of minutes. In short great drive at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Troy Moppin III

customer_reviews.title: Fast!  Not too expensive
customer_reviews.text: Worked fast as promised. Software not clear but figured out.
customer_reviews.author: Craig C. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Hoping for an amendment
customer_reviews.text: I plugged this harddrive in 3 times before it stopped working. I'd be happy to exchange or return this harddrive but unfortunately their return policy is inconveniently short. After the one month time period, I had only plugged the drive in twice. There is no way to know if it was just this harddrive that was faulty or if this problem occurs often. Because of this I can't recommend the drive or the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable drives - AVOID
customer_reviews.text: I had my first drive replaced under warranty within 12 months...that was a pain but every manufacturer has bad units. The replacement drive just failed after another 18 months...game over. I have backups but lost some of my most recent data and must now scramble to cobble together another storage solution. I can't recommend this drive for storage to anyone who needs reliable storage and will avoid Buffalo products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: DerekM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent external hard drive.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! really a fast and very well made device. I bought it from Amazon Warehouse and really it's an excellent product. I use it "just plug and work" daily and it's fast as expected from an USB 3.0 disk. Thanks, Leo
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for less than 2 years, then began having trouble. Won't read at all at this point. Has never been moved around, so whatever 'wear' it had was simply from being read and written to. Won't be buying this again!
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit, but needs some redesign on the power brick.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and quiet. The only thing that I don't like is the HUGE power supply block. Not so much the size, but it's integrated with the plug and covers 3 outlets in a power strip. Can't be plugged into an UPS without blocking other UPS outlets. They should have had a short length of cord from the brick so that a normal sized plug could be used. Other than that, it's a good unit.
customer_reviews.author: TA

customer_reviews.title: Worked great ... for about 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: Until today this would have been a 4-5 star product for me. It's fast. Not fussy. That all lasted about 4 months. Today it's inexplicably inaccessible. I've never had this happen with all the WD drives I'd had in the past (maybe eight of them over the years?) Based on positive reviews I got this one and got burned today. If I hadn't read about others with the same experience I might have written this off as a defective unit. Looks like I'm going to have to recover my files to a brand new WD drive.
customer_reviews.author: Dascoyne

customer_reviews.title: Bad Drive. Worse Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: The drive I was sent did not function properly. It did not work with Windows or Mac. I sent an email to Buffalo customer service. They sent an automated response that someone would be contacting me shortly. I never heard from anyone. After two weeks I finally called them. When I reached customer service I was informed that this drive won't work with Max OS 10.8 which is not mentioned on the Amazon page.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Davis

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with BUFFALO!
customer_reviews.text: I looked at a computer (pc mag) website that rated hard drives. They stated that BUFFALO WAS BEST. I got it and it is super fast. It backed up 5000 + iTunes songs and 7000 + pictures very quickly compared to WD backups that i have purchased in the past. WD always had software problems and bugs. I am very happy with BUFFALO!
customer_reviews.author: Texanlaura

customer_reviews.title: Expected More
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what happened here, product worked fine for a few weeks and then the power supply went caput. I broke open the case, took the hard drive out and plugged it in directly through a SATA-->USB dock and hard drive works fine and still has the data. Not sure what happened with power supply.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Defoe

customer_reviews.title: Failed twice
customer_reviews.text: Based on my experience, I cannot recommend this product. Within weeks of my purchase, the drive failed and had to be sent to the manufacturer for replacement. I was disappointed to learn that to get the product replaced I had to (a) pay for shipping myself and (b) the replacement unit would be a used/refurbished unit. I've had the replacement unit for a couple of months and now it is failing as well in a similar fashion. Over time, the drive simply fails to power on and cannot be recognized by my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Thrash

customer_reviews.title: Good experience....
customer_reviews.text: I hope I'm not jinxing myself but I've had nothing but excellent experiences using these Buffalo drives. Actually the first one I bought was in 2003 and it still works so I decided to replace an already failing 3 year old external hdd with this one. This drive runs quite silently and the transfer speed is blazing via usb 3.0.
customer_reviews.author: EmeryLee

customer_reviews.title: Great speed and quiet
customer_reviews.text: After a great deal of research, I decided to give the buffalo drivestation DDR 3 TB a try. It is super fast for my Windows Media Center TV recordings and no more hesitation from the drive not being able to handle 3 recorded shows at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie C

customer_reviews.title: Works fast, dies young
customer_reviews.text: Was impressed with this drive. Until it died unexpectedly in less than 6 mo. I was so impressed with Buffalo that that I purchased the 2x3TB raid 1 drive station to back it up with. Glad I did! Question is what to replace it with. Shall I repeat the same mistake, hoping for a better outcome?
customer_reviews.author: Michael Washington

customer_reviews.title: Good backup drive, but...
customer_reviews.text: terrible solfware. The first time I tried to use it with it's own software, it ran for hours, then said there wasn't enough room on the drive (ridiculous). I then reformatted it & used Acronis Backup & Recovery software with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Helva

customer_reviews.title: Ok..... After the 3rd one.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Buffalo Drive Station which had great reviews. Received the 1st one...did not work. Sent the first one back & ordered another. The 2nd one did not work. Called the company & was told it may have been a bad batch & something the engineers will need to look at. Sent that one back & ordered for the 3rd time. The 3rd one worked! Hopefully it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Drive is completely dead after almost exactly two months of desk use. I plug it in and a warning window pops up saying that Windows does not recognize the device. Do not buy this product!
customer_reviews.author: J. Clow

customer_reviews.title: This drive is exceptionally fast and quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Every other drive I have except this one and the one in the computer are USB2. since I use it for storage most of the files I transfer are from the USB3 drive in the computer to this one and the transfers are amazingly fast. It is quiet and works exceptionally well.
customer_reviews.author: Riklaa

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the first one...so easy to use. No space consuming software to deal with. Just drag and drop. Loved it so much, bought 2 more for one dedicated just to pictures/videos, and one to alternate backing up on.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanie Luna

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!  Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this external hard drive last month to use for onsite back up for my new iMac. Before setting up as a back up storage device I first formatted it to be windows compatible and used it to transfer a large amount of data from my old PC to the new iMac. I then reformatted it in Mac OS format and am now using it to back up the iMac. It works very well and is very quiet. Given the quality and flexibility of the device, I felt the price was quite a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Hoffhines

customer_reviews.title: rocket fuel for your data
customer_reviews.text: this thing is awesome. I do daily backups of over 4TB of data broken out among numerous drives and partitions... I've observed it handle all those backup plans consecutively, from start to finish, in approximately 2 hours. It runs so fast in the background and causes no hiccup whatsoever to my system. can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: steelcouch97

customer_reviews.title: Bought two and both died quickly!  Entirely unreliable hard drive, in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these 3 TB Buffalo Drive Station drives and BOTH failed. Entirely unreliable as an external drive or storage device in my opinion; both of mine did not consistently mount on any of my Macs, and it was always hit and miss whether they'd work. Not what is needed when we're storing important files! I've had dozens of external drives over the years and none failed as quickly as these did...and BOTH of mine died with VERY VERY little use.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Fine for one use, but then failed
customer_reviews.text: I backed up my data to this drive about a week after purchasing it, and it worked okay the first time. But now, a little more than a month later, it doesn't work anymore.
customer_reviews.author: C.L.

customer_reviews.title: Completely failed after a month and a half.
customer_reviews.text: Completely failed...no lights, no fan no disk sounds. Buffalo sent me a new transformer but it still did not work. Buffalo offered to replace but my data is too precious.
customer_reviews.author: maholly

customer_reviews.title: Great for backup on my new computer.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Buffalo to give me plenty of space for backup of my new desktop, which has USB 3.0 ports. So far, it is all positive. Has been 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The hard drive failed after 6 months use. My mac won't recognize the drive and the indicator lights won't come on anymore. They are replacing the drive but all the data is lost.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick R

customer_reviews.title: Drive failed after 3 months. When I called the ...
customer_reviews.text: Drive failed after 3 months. When I called the company, they tried to blame the failure on me. Apparently, the drive is not meant for heavy/normal use. They are going to likely replace the drive, but I have to pay for shipping. Not much sympathy for loss of data and loss of time in setting up a new drive. I will never buy another buffalo product. I have lost all trust in the company.
customer_reviews.author: jennybaltimore

customer_reviews.title: Fast drive with huge capacity
customer_reviews.text: Buffalo is one of my favorite external hard drive manufacturers, tried Western Digital but these are faster and NOT locked into Apples iTunes. Great since I am a Windows person.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip J. Seaman

customer_reviews.title: After a few months, no longer starts up
customer_reviews.text: At first this drive worked great, now only a few months later it no longer starts up when plugged in. There is no on/off switch to try to make connection and the internal fan starts turning and it sounds as if the drive is booting when plugged in, however the power light does not turn on and no connection to the computer is made. About about 20-30 times of plugging and unplugging you might be lucky to make a connection. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Riddle

customer_reviews.title: STOPPED WORKING!
customer_reviews.text: STOPPED WORKING! Less than a year old. I was in the tech field for 35 years. I did not abuse this drive.
customer_reviews.author: anthony cassara

customer_reviews.title: Beware: drive is not bootable for Mac OSX/awful customer service
customer_reviews.text: Bought the drive, planning to use it as a bootable drive for MAC OSX. Product description does not make clear that this is not possible. Contacted customer service at Buffalo about the issue and finally got a reply 6 weeks later. Their reply? The drive is able to boot Mac OSX [contrary to multiple reports online/and no reports confirming it does boot] but "setting this up would be outside of our scope of support."
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Lightning fast
customer_reviews.text: This buffalo hd is by far faster then the wd ultra I have. It's rating of 3x the write speed may be an understatement. I'm very happy with it, although it is a little noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Pete L

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well
customer_reviews.text: I use this 3tb drive to store my 2+ tb itunes library with my Mac Mini. It seems to be very fast indeed. Make sure that you have plenty of RAM on your computer as this drive will use some for its caching functions.
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: A fast, quiet, 3TB USB 3.0 drive. Easily moves around. I don't have another USB 3 drive to compare it to for speed, but I'm very happy with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Only good for storing files
customer_reviews.text: The mention of using RAM and claiming to have GDDR3 RAM and such might lead you to believe it has its own internal RAM, like I was. It does not. It uses the PC's RAM to increase speeds, and a lot of it, which makes it practically useless for running programs out of; my whole reason for purchasing it. Unless you have a hell of a lot of RAM (no less than 8GB, which is still cutting it close), running programs from it will quickly cause your RAM to overreach and create problems. I've also been having problems with it occasionally shutting down or losing connection, which is likely tied to the insufficient RAM issue.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this external drive
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this external drive. I ended up buying another one but with 4 TB. It is fast and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great product although!

product_meta.title: Buffalo DriveStation DDR External Hard Drive 2 TB
product_meta.description: Capacity:2 TBBUFFALO drive station DDR is an easy to use, High performance USB 3.0 desktop hard drive that offers Ultra fast transfer speeds, comparable to SSD. Combining the high capacity of an HDD with 1 GB of DRAM cache, drive station DDR provides ssd-like performance. With blazing fast transfer speeds up to 408 MB/s, It is up to 3x faster than USB 3.0 and 10x faster than USB 2.0. Perfect for any PC or Mac, it's backward compatible with USB 2.0, and its unique chassis design can stand upright or lay flat for placement just about anywhere. It ships complete with BUFFALO tools, a feature-rich software suite designed to enhance computer performance and the day-to-day digital life of Windows PC consumers; boost performance, conserve energy and battery consumption and perform PC backups. Drive station DDR is the perfect solution for easily expanding storage or backing up your computer with Ultra fast file transfers.
